body_html: @alextp. oh, that's bad. Okay, If I manage to pass f(x) as python function, hence at each iteration I construct new tensor y = f(x), does it mean that the size of the graph will grow linearly with number of iterations? Can an unwise usage of while_loop lead to the graph "overflow", taking into account that graph size is limited?

body: @alextp. oh, that's bad. Okay, If I manage to pass f(x) as python function, hence at each iteration I construct new tensor `y = f(x)`, does it mean that the size of the graph will grow linearly with number of iterations? Can an unwise usage of `while_loop` lead to the graph "overflow", taking into account that graph size is limited?
